content.description:
I haven't climbed this one; including it for completeness sake. 

  This route is on the right side of the face, of the large block, to the left of Terror Dome.  The direct start goes 5.10, easily.
content.protection: Allegedly adequate.  All gear anchor.  Watch out for copperheads in the cracks.
content.location: Start on boulders by right arete and traverse left onto face to crack; climb up to big ledge, traverse left 10 feet, follow crack with bush in it to top.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: Starting at a large boulder place your left hand on the arete and climb up the narrow face. The crux is a fairly easy move but tenuous for a 5.5 leader, and your gear is at your feet. This route is not recommended for someone not comfortable at the grade.
content.protection: A standard Gunks rack offers mediocre pro. A gear anchor is possible at the top with large pieces (#4/#5) but I suspect most people will walk back to trees about 30 feet from the edge.
content.location: Starting on a large boulder, climb up the slabby right side of the arete at the right end of the Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man face.

content.description: A classic Gunks-type climb, with a long traverse under a roof.  Don't TR this route; the pendulum could easily cut the rope, and the swing is horrific regardless.  Contrary to how it looks, the traverse is not the crux.
content.location: Start anywhere in the slabs under Terror Dome and work your way up into the corner, follow corner to large ceiling, traverse left using obvious crack and out onto face; continue to top.    Easy walk-off.

content.description: Never climbed this; including it for completeness sake.
content.location: This route goes up the left-hand dihedral to underneath the lower roof of the Terror Dome, escapes left onto face/offwidth crack, to the top.  Easy walk-off.

climbs.name: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

content.protection: Adequate, but not generous.  All gear anchor at top.  Watch out for copperheads in the cracks.
content.location: This route is on the left arete of the large block of Terror Dome.  Start at blocks below and to the left of the arete, and traverse right to gain the face.  Wander up the left side of the face, just right of the arete, and aiming for the cracks on the left. Easy walk-off.

content.description: A very large roof.  The face routes receive a LOT of sun.
